item.title: Report E-2024060676
item.description:
Report E-2024060676

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-24
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 5-gallon poly pail due to a nail puncture. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed a neutralizer and granular absorbent to the impacted area. The spent material was recovered and containerized along with the damaged pail into one (1) 15-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060468
item.description:
Report E-2024060468

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-01T15:12:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: NORTH RIDGEVILLE
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 3ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to a puncture to one (1) poly tote. Hepaco personnel stated that prior to their arrival ESTES terminal personnel had cleaned the impacted area. The area was tested and confirmed as neutralized. The spent material was containerized into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The remaining product in the damaged tote was transferred to a new tote. The empty tote was cut up and placed into two (2) cubic yard boxes. All the generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060603
item.description:
Report E-2024060603

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-28T18:14:46+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: UPPER SANDUSKY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Pitt Ohio
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival at the relay point, the drum was discovered to be leaking inside the van trailer. Due to the nature of the material, a spill response company was called to the scene to clean up the released material and overpack the punctured drum. Investigation revealed that the drum was punctured by a protruding nail on the skid. The packaging specifications were not able to be safely obtained before the drum was placed into an overpack.

item.title: Report E-2024060593
item.description:
Report E-2024060593

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-22
  • City: PERRYSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: First Call Environmental was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted three (3) metal pails and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due one (1) damaged 5-gallon metal pail. First Call Environmental personnel containerized the damaged pail and the three (3) impacted pails into two (2) 55-gallon metal drums. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060554
item.description:
Report E-2024060554

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-27T15:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-14
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 14, 2024, two (2) 5-gallon pails of UN1263 were damaged due to improper loading and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the area. All waste was containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024061414

Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the cleanup debris and staged the generated waste onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060533
item.description:
Report E-2024060533

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-17
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately five (5) pounds of material released from two (2) 50-pound plastic bags due to contact with a sharp object that punctured the bags. The released material impacted the concrete terminal floor. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the recovered material. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2024060534
item.description:
Report E-2024060534

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-26T15:13:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-10
  • City: SOUTH POINT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 2-gallons of Sodium Hydroxide Solution (UN1824) was released. The caller stated that the released product was contained to the dock floor at door #17. ERTS advised contractor HEPACO would respond due to the corrosive state of the product and amount released. HEPACO advised Oil Dri was applied to the impacted area and the concrete dock was neutralized with a muriatic acid solution. The damaged drum was then placed into a 95-gallon poly drum and the impacted absorbents, pads and PPE were placed into a 55-gallon poly drum for disposal. There were no drains, soils or waterways reported to have been impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2024060517
item.description:
Report E-2024060517

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-07
  • City: PARMA HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO XCL notified ERTS of an 8-oz. release of UN1830, Sulfuric acid from a 750 lb. DF due to a puncture caused by improper loading at the top of the drum. The spill was contained to the pallet on the dock floor. Due to the corrosive product the caller requested assistance with spill response.
